Here are some specific problems I have related to that: - The value of ECS is given as a range of 1.5-4.5C. These values have not changed since the Charney Report in 1979. After billions of dollar in climate research and 36 years of work, the range has not been narrowed. - The common value for the median ECS is 3C and climate models use this value (or slightly above it). But many recent studies have come up with a median value much lower, closer to 2C. - If we assume a median ECS of 3C and given the amount of warming since the industrial era and given the amount of CO2 man has put into the atmosphere, especially over the past 30 years, for models to be correct, warming will have to accelerate to a very high rate.
